main event: An unidentified flying object was observed on April 29, 1953, over the North Pacific, northwest of the Hawaiian Islands.
interesting points: The object was traveling at a speed estimated to be faster than a jet aircraft., The object appeared to be metallic silver in color and circular in shape., Witnesses noted that the object's movements were erratic, making sharp turns at right angles and near vertical climbs., One eyewitness described the object as being approximately the size of an F-80 fighter aircraft., No photographs or physical evidence were recovered from the sighting.
witness description: armed forces officers aboard the USNS General A. W. Brewster
